name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

key_work.title: down among the wild men / colonial imagination
key_work.material_description: Video loop, artist and Michael Bonner (performer)
key_work.brief_description: Shadow play, projection and performance combine to question our history and shift the colonial gaze in Ali Gumillya Baker’s mixed media video installation.

constellations_primary.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_primary.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

constellations_other.name: Keep the fire burning
constellations_other.description: Yanmeeyarr, meaning ‘flickering in firelight’, shares how light and shadow are at the core of the moving image. It reflects the past, present and future of stories told by First Peoples utilising these elements, as well as bringing to light stories that have, for too long, been kept in the dark.

start.title: Blade Runner 2049
start.creator_credit: Andrew A. Kosove, Broderick Johnson, Bud Yorkin, Cynthia Sikes, Ridley Scott and Daniel Thron
start.headline_credit: Canada, Hungary, Mexico, Spain, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2017
start.brief_description: Thirty years after Blade Runner, a new blade runner K unearths a secret that has the potential to plunge society into chaos. K’s discovery leads him on a quest to find Rick Deckard, a former LAPD blade runner who has been missing for 30 years.

constellations_other.name: Alternate histories and futures
constellations_other.description: Sue Ford's Egami reimagines contemporary life through a feminist and colonial lens.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

end.title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
end.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment, Universal Pictures, James D. Bissell, Melissa Mathison, Al Bailey and Carlo Rambaldi
end.brief_description: After a gentle alien becomes stranded on Earth, the being is discovered and befriended by a young boy named Elliott. Bringing the extraterrestrial into his suburban California house, Elliott introduces E.T., as the alien is dubbed, to his brother and his little sister, Gertie, and the children decide to keep its existence a secret. Soon, however, E.T. falls ill, resulting in government intervention and a dire situation for both Elliott and the alien.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

links.description: Steven Spielberg truly captured the magic of silhouette with his enchanting bicycle flight set against the backdrop of the full moon. Instantly iconic, the image became the logo representing his production company, Amblin Entertainment.

start.title: Psycho
start.brief_description: When real estate clerk Marion Crane goes on the lam with a wad of cash, she ends up at the notorious Bates Motel, where manager Norman Bates cares for his housebound mother. All seems okay, until Marion decides to take a shower…

constellations_other.name: Good vibrations
constellations_other.description: Since its invention, the humble theremin has been used in a number of different ways to evoke all sorts of strange sounds and moods.

constellations_other.name: When music speaks
constellations_other.description: Some characters or moments are expressed more intensely through a musical motif than dialogue or action.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

constellations_other.name: Painting pictures
constellations_other.description: Painter and photographer Louis Le Prince was inspired to develop the technology to make animated pictures by the circular panoramic paintings of his friends. His films captured everyday life and alluded to his artistic vision for cinema.

end.title: Blade Runner 2049
end.creator_credit: Andrew A. Kosove, Broderick Johnson, Bud Yorkin, Cynthia Sikes, Ridley Scott and Daniel Thron
end.headline_credit: Canada, Hungary, Mexico, Spain, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2017
end.brief_description: Thirty years after Blade Runner, a new blade runner K unearths a secret that has the potential to plunge society into chaos. K’s discovery leads him on a quest to find Rick Deckard, a former LAPD blade runner who has been missing for 30 years.

constellations_other.name: Alternate histories and futures
constellations_other.description: Sue Ford's Egami reimagines contemporary life through a feminist and colonial lens.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

links.description: Inspired by images of a severe dust storm in Sydney in 2009, cinematographer Roger Deakins shot Ryan Gosling’s ‘K’ dramatically silhouetted against the orange haze of a post-apocalyptic Las Vegas. The vivid photography depicting K as both inexplicably apart of and separated from this eerie other place.

start.title: down among the wild men / colonial imagination
start.material_description: Video loop, artist and Michael Bonner (performer)
start.brief_description: Shadow play, projection and performance combine to question our history and shift the colonial gaze in Ali Gumillya Baker’s mixed media video installation.

constellations_primary.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

constellations_other.description: Yanmeeyarr, meaning ‘flickering in firelight’, shares how light and shadow are at the core of the moving image. It reflects the past, present and future of stories told by First Peoples utilising these elements, as well as bringing to light stories that have, for too long, been kept in the dark.

end.title: Nosferatu
end.creator_credit: Albin Grau, Enrico Dieckmann and Jofa-Atelier Berlin-Johannisthal
end.brief_description: Vampire Count Orlok isn’t just interested in a new residence, but also the wife of his young real estate agent in F.W. Murnau’s unauthorised adaptation of Bram Stoker’s Dracula. Shot in the German Expressionist style, this groundbreaking vampire film influenced film noir and Hollywood horrors.

constellations_other.name: Spooky shadows
constellations_other.description: Hellish and hilarious vampires connect pioneering German cinema to contemporary New Zealand comedy with a quick detour into small town strangeness.

constellations_other.name: Shadowplay and spookiness
constellations_other.description: Silhouettes and shadows scare up some of the most sinister creatures in cinema and videogames.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

links.description: At a time when special effects were in their infancy, F.W. Murnau relied heavily on shadow and silhouette to create the menacing vampire Count Orlock in his unauthorised adaptation of Dracula. Cinematographer Fritz Arno Wagner’s haunting use of light brought nightmarish horror to the silver screen.

start.title: Nosferatu
start.creator_credit: Albin Grau, Enrico Dieckmann and Jofa-Atelier Berlin-Johannisthal
start.brief_description: Vampire Count Orlok isn’t just interested in a new residence, but also the wife of his young real estate agent in F.W. Murnau’s unauthorised adaptation of Bram Stoker’s Dracula. Shot in the German Expressionist style, this groundbreaking vampire film influenced film noir and Hollywood horrors.

constellations_other.description: Hellish and hilarious vampires connect pioneering German cinema to contemporary New Zealand comedy with a quick detour into small town strangeness.

constellations_other.description: Silhouettes and shadows scare up some of the most sinister creatures in cinema and videogames.

constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

constellations_other.name: Painting pictures
constellations_other.description: Painter and photographer Louis Le Prince was inspired to develop the technology to make animated pictures by the circular panoramic paintings of his friends. His films captured everyday life and alluded to his artistic vision for cinema.

links.description: Alfred Hitchcock brought a similar sense of physiological menace to the bathroom scene in Psycho. Only seen in silhouette through the show curtain, the killer’s terrifying image drew upon Hitchcock’s background in German Expressionism gained from his time at UFA Babelsberg Studios in Berlin in 1924.

start.title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
start.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment, Universal Pictures, James D. Bissell, Melissa Mathison, Al Bailey and Carlo Rambaldi
start.brief_description: After a gentle alien becomes stranded on Earth, the being is discovered and befriended by a young boy named Elliott. Bringing the extraterrestrial into his suburban California house, Elliott introduces E.T., as the alien is dubbed, to his brother and his little sister, Gertie, and the children decide to keep its existence a secret. Soon, however, E.T. falls ill, resulting in government intervention and a dire situation for both Elliott and the alien.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

end.title: The Lion king
end.creator_credit: Rob Minkoff, Roger Allers, Don Hahn and Walt Disney Pictures
end.brief_description: This beautifully animated and wonderfully scored feature film tells the story of the love between a proud lion ruler, Mufasa, and his son, Simba - a naive and curious cub who must find his place in the “circle of life”. Through the help of his friends, and his determination to meet the toughest challenges, Simba eventually takes his place as the rightful ruler of the Pride Lands. His search to meet his destiny puts him face to face in a struggle to the death with his evil uncle Scar and also leads him towards true love. Elton John and Tim Rice’s award winning songs, an excellent score by Hans Zimmer, and voice characterisations by Jeremy Irons, James Earl Jones, Rowan Atkinson, Robert Guillame, Moira Kelly and Matthew Broderick as Simba, make this an unforgettable experience.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

constellations_other.name: Migrations
constellations_other.description: Universal Everything's Migrations features fantastical creatures born from elements of other animals, just like the titles in this Constellation.

links.description: Where best to hide an easter egg but in a silhouette? Often concealing references to the Disney universe in their films, it’s no surprise that Jock the Scottish terrier from Lady and the Tramp can be found hiding amongst the hyenas of Pride Rock.

start.title: The Lion king
start.creator_credit: Rob Minkoff, Roger Allers, Don Hahn and Walt Disney Pictures
start.brief_description: This beautifully animated and wonderfully scored feature film tells the story of the love between a proud lion ruler, Mufasa, and his son, Simba - a naive and curious cub who must find his place in the “circle of life”. Through the help of his friends, and his determination to meet the toughest challenges, Simba eventually takes his place as the rightful ruler of the Pride Lands. His search to meet his destiny puts him face to face in a struggle to the death with his evil uncle Scar and also leads him towards true love. Elton John and Tim Rice’s award winning songs, an excellent score by Hans Zimmer, and voice characterisations by Jeremy Irons, James Earl Jones, Rowan Atkinson, Robert Guillame, Moira Kelly and Matthew Broderick as Simba, make this an unforgettable experience.

The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

constellations_other.name: Migrations
constellations_other.description: Universal Everything's Migrations features fantastical creatures born from elements of other animals, just like the titles in this Constellation.

end.title: Top of the Lake
end.creator_credit: Escapade Pictures, Screen Australia and See-Saw Films
end.brief_description: A woman haunted by her past, Detective Robin Griffin, investigates complex and unsettling cases.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

constellations_other.name: Australians on the world stage
constellations_other.description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Max Rockatansky’s journey dispensing justice across the wasteland in his V8 Interceptor became a cult classic and catapulted Australian cinema onto the world stage.

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

links.description: Her films are known for breathtaking visual storytelling with characters often situated within majestic landscapes. Jane Campion brought her signature style to the small screen in Top of the Lake, using silhouette to dramatically position protagonists within the grandeur of the New Zealand environment.
